newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Riksbank says lower bond yields could be justified.
newsitem.headline: Riksbank says lower bond yields could be justified.

text.p: Swedish long bond yields should fall because the outlook for inflation was good, the central bank said.
"I think there is enough justification for longer bond yields to be lower," the Riksbank's deputy governor Lars Heikensten told a news conference.
He said this move was also justified by the fact that the state of Sweden's budget appeared good.
Heikensten said economic and political uncertainty had increased and emphasised that the international picture influenced any domestic developments.
Sweden's ten year bond yields were two basis points higher at 7.50 percent at midday Thursday.
